isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9200, 9300, 9400 Models Built After January 1, 1995 - ELECTRICAL TROUBLESHOOTING SLEEPER LIGHTING AND ACCESSORIES - OPERATION - TV/VCR Wiring W/PRO SLEEPER

svcproc.title: TV/VCR Wiring W/PRO SLEEPER
svcproc.para: With the TV/VCR ON/OFF Switch in the position, power flows from battery stud B2 through circuit 14AK, 14AV, fuse F10 - B, circuit 14AX, fuse 582 - A, circuit 86X, TV/VCR ON/OFF Switch, and circuit 86Y. The power then splits up on 86AR to the TV Power Source socket, and 86AN to the VCR Power Source socket. The ground path is circuit 86 - GP from the TV socket and 86 - GN from the VCR socket, to 11 - GAC, 11 - GAD, 11 - GBD, and 11 - GBE to ground adapter (454). When the ignition is turned ON, power energizes the Auxiliary Bunk Blower Relay which makes available power to circuits 75X and 62Y going to TV/VCR ON/OFF Switch. This illuminates the panel lamp LED through ground path 62 - GY, 11 - GAF, 11 - GBC, 11 - GBD, and 11 - GBE to ground adapter (454).
